name: Customer
description: A person who may make a complaint about breastfeeding or expressing in the store.
constraints: Do not overload totes â€“ the safe working load is 16 kgs.
Where possible, use four-sided (or wraparound) H-Cages to move weights to prevent them from falling/rolling out.
Do not double stack dumbbell Shelf Ready Packaging (SRPs) or hex dumbbells.
Turn hex dumbbells longways onto shelf to prevent rolling.
Ensure the locking mechanism is in place for the weight plate stands.
caveats: Sometimes, other customers will take offence to seeing a mother breastfeeding or expressing in one of our stores.
bestPractice: Seek help from your Store Manager if you are unsure.
If you receive a complaint from a customer you may advise them that this is a women's right under Australian Federal Law.
If you are uncomfortable, unsure, or if the complaint escalates seek help from your Store Manager.
No one should ever be asked by a team member to cover themselves or stop breastfeeding or expressing anywhere in our stores. This includes in fitting rooms or on the shop floor.
